org.cyy.fw.android.dborm.sqlite

类 SqliteDBFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • SQLiteOpenHelper
      • org.cyy.fw.android.dborm.sqlite.SqliteDBFacade

  • public abstract class SqliteDBFacade
extends SQLiteOpenHelper
    SQLite DB Accessed Facade, called by application code.
    The facade provides several interface for DB accessing with a OO style by simple O-R mapping, such as query(Class, Object), insert(Object), update(Object, Object), delete(Class, Object) and so on. User can operate the DB table the same as simple java object, without caring about any SQL details, but of course, this is a ideal scenario, you still have to turn to SQLs in some complex scenario. User also can build SQLs by provided API, such as buildDeleteSql(Class, Object), buildInsertSql(Object[]), buildUpdateSql(Object, Object) and so on, and execute this SQLs by calling execSQL(SQLObject[]) passing the returned SQLObject parameter.
    This framework define the O-R mapping by java annotation:

  • Here are four annotation that fulfill mapping tasks: Table, Column, PrimaryKey, OneToAny

    Table is a Class annotation, it mappings the DB table and POJO, the name attribute is used to specified the table name, the framework will use the Class simple name for table name if this name attribute hasn't a non-null value. 

     @Table(name = "t1")
 public static class TestTable
 {
 }
    The above class will mapping to the table named 't1'.
    The framework allow a java class mappings several tables, the name attribute is a array type. 
     @Table(name = { "t1", "t2", "t3" })
 public static class TestTable {
        // ...
 }
    By the above code fragment, TestTable mappings tables named 't1' 't2' 't3', you must specified table name when accessing DB in this case, otherwise, the framework will access the first table(it is 't1' in this example), the most APIs have a tablename parameter, such as query(Class, Object, String), the last parameter is the tablename parameter.
    Column is the annotation used to mapping the class attributes with table columns, the name attribute of this annotation specifies the column name, the attribute name will be the column name if this attribute hasn't a non-null value. It's the sample as follow: 
     @Table(name = "t1")
 public static class TestTable {
        @PrimaryKey(columnName = "id1")
        private Integer id;
        @Column(name = "name1")
        private String name;
        private String address;
        @Column
        private Double money;
 
        public Integer getId() {
                return id;
        }
 
        public void setId(Integer id) {
                this.id = id;
        }
 
        public String getName() {
                return name;
        }
 
        public void setName(String name) {
                this.name = name;
        }
 
        public String getAddress() {
                return address;
        }
 
        public void setAddress(String address) {
                this.address = address;
        }
 
        public Double getMoney() {
                return money;
        }
 
        public void setMoney(Double money) {
                this.money = money;
        }
 
 }
    PrimaryKey is similar with Column, it's the primary key annotation, the primary key will be auto-incremented and generated by DB if the sequence attribute is set true, or the primary key value will be generated by the framework if the genUIDBySelf attribute is set true. The table will haven't primary key if any attribute of the mapped class defined with this annotation.
    OneToAny is used to specify one-to-one or one-to-many relation of two tables, acts on the complex attribute of mapped class, it has three attribute:
    target: The relation target full class name, if class attribute's type is a POJO class or generic List(must be generic and so sorry for just supporting List so far), this annotation attribute can be null, because the framework can check the target in this case.
    sourceField: relation source attribute, the framework will use primary key if the value is null
    targetField: relation target attribute, it will appear in the left join part while building SQLs
     @Table(name = "t1")
 public static class TestTable {
        @PrimaryKey(columnName = "id1", sequence = true)
        private Integer id;
        @OneToAny(targetField = "bid")
        private T2 brother;
        @OneToAny(targetField = "pid")
        private List<Child> childList;
 
        public T2 getBrother() {
                return brother;
        }
 
        public void setBrother(T2 brother) {
                this.brother = brother;
        }
 
        public Integer getId() {
                return id;
        }
 
        public void setId(Integer id) {
                this.id = id;
        }
 
        public List<Child> getChildList() {
                return childList;
        }
 
        public void setChildList(List<Child> childList) {
                this.childList = childList;
        }
 
 }
 
 @Table(name = "c1")
 public static class Child {
        @PrimaryKey(columnName = "id1", sequence = true)
        private Integer id;
        @Column
        private Integer pid;
 
        @Column(name = "name")
        private String childName;
 
        public Integer getId() {
                return id;
        }
 
        public void setId(Integer id) {
                this.id = id;
        }
 
        public Integer getPid() {
                return pid;
        }
 
        public void setPid(Integer pid) {
                this.pid = pid;
        }
 
        public String getChildName() {
                return childName;
        }
 
        public void setChildName(String childName) {
                this.childName = childName;
        }
 
 }
 
 @Table
 public static class T2 {
        @PrimaryKey(columnName = "id2")
        private Integer id;
        @Column
        private String n1;
        @Column
        private Integer bid;
 
        public Integer getId() {
                return id;
        }
 
        public void setId(Integer id) {
                this.id = id;
        }
 
        public String getN1() {
                return n1;
        }
 
        public void setN1(String n1) {
                this.n1 = n1;
        }
 
        public Integer getBid() {
                return bid;
        }
 
        public void setBid(Integer bid) {
                this.bid = bid;
        }
 
 }
    The above TestTable class defines two relation attribute: brother and childList relate T2 class and Child class separately, and will generate the SQL segment "left join T2 on T2.bid = t1.id1 left join c1 on c1.pid = t1.id1" while building SQLs
    The AnnotationORMapper class will fulfill the mapping logic.

    Note: The POJO class must comply with the beans specifications:
    (1).The mapped attribute must have pair of setter and getter, and the name of getter and setter must comply with java bean specifications, you can generate them by eclipse->Source->Generate Getters and Setters.
    (2).If the attribute is a primary type, you'd better use the wrapper class of the primary type, such as Integer, Float and so on.
    User can implement the ORMapper interface to customize mapping logic and injection it by calling setOrMapper(ORMapper)

    This facade class is a abstract class, user need to extend it and do a few things more:
    (1).Name the DB, android will create the specified DB file in the databases folder of the application
    (2).Implement the configureORMClasses() method, configure all mapped POJO classes, the DB will create tables accordinging to this configured classes

版本:
[V1.0, 2012-11-5]
作者:
cyy

    • 方法详细资料

      • buildCreateSql

        public SQLObject buildCreateSql(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                       java.lang.String tableName)
        build create table SQL
        参数:
        clazz - POJO class
        tableName - table name
        返回:
        SQL object

      • buildDeleteSql

        public SQLObject buildDeleteSql(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                       java.lang.Object condition)
        Generate delete SQL accordinging by condition described by POJO.
        参数:
        clazz - POJO class, if the condition parameter is a non-null value, this parameter is allowed to be null, otherwise isn't.
        condition - Delete condition, described by POJO, for example, a condition object has two attributes a=1 and b="b1", it will suggest the framework to build a SQL "where part a=1 and b = 'b'" for the final SQL. The null value attribute will be ignored while building SQL where part, so the POJO's primary type attribute is suggested to use the wrapper class of the specified primary type instead, because all primary types have a default value, if a POJO has a int type attribute named intAttr, its value will be 0 if it hasn't been set any value, so the framework will append a "intAttr = 0" SQL segment for the final SQL. The condition parameter can be a null value, if i's null, the framework will query all data rows of the specified table, but keep in mind that, the clazz parameter of this method must be a non-null value if the condition parameter is null, otherwise the framework will have no idea what table you want to query.
        返回:
        Delete SQL object includes SQL and binded parameter

      • buildDeleteSql

        public SQLObject buildDeleteSql(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                       java.lang.Object condition,
                       java.lang.String tableName)
        Generate delete SQL of the specified table according by condition described by POJO.
        参数:
        clazz - As same as buildDeleteSql(Class, Object)
        condition - As same as condition parameter of buildDeleteSql(Class, Object)
        tableName - The table's name
        返回:
        Delete SQL object includes SQL and binded parameter

      • buildInsertSql

        public SQLObject[] buildInsertSql(java.lang.Object[] entities)
        Generate the insert SQL
        参数:
        entities - The POJOs to be inserted
        返回:
        Insert SQL object includes SQL and binded parameter

      • buildInsertSql

        public SQLObject[] buildInsertSql(java.lang.Object[] entities,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,java.lang.String> tableMap)
        Generate the insert SQL for some specified tables
        参数:
        entities - The POJOs to be inserted
        tableMap - The table name map, the key is the POJO class, the value is the table name
        返回:
        Insert SQL object includes SQL and binded parameter

      • buildCascadeInsertSqls

        public SQLObject[] buildCascadeInsertSqls(java.lang.Object[] objects,
                                 java.lang.Class<?>[] childrenClasses,
                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,java.lang.String> tableMap)
        Generate the insert SQL for some specified tables
        It will process relationship.
        参数:
        objects - The POJOs to be inserted
        childrenClasses - The parameter is used to check whether need to generate the inserted SQL for the target relation POJO, if this parameter is null, all the attributes which have the OneToAny annotation will generate a insert SQL for the target POJO.
        tableMap - The table name map, the key is the POJO class, the value is the table name
        返回:
        Insert SQL object includes SQL and binded parameter

      • buildUpdateSql

        public SQLObject buildUpdateSql(java.lang.Object newValue,
                       java.lang.Object condition)
        Generate update SQL according by condition described by POJO.
        参数:
        newValue - The updated value, described by POJO, if it has a attribute named a has a non-value 1 and a attribute named b has a null value, it will generate the SQL segment set a = 1 for the final SQL and the attribute will be ignored for SQL.
        condition - As same as condition parameter of buildDeleteSql(Class, Object)
        返回:
        Update SQL

      • buildUpdateSql

        public SQLObject buildUpdateSql(java.lang.Object newValue,
                       java.lang.Object condition,
                       java.lang.String tableName)
        Generate update SQL of the specified table according by condition described by POJO.
        参数:
        newValue - The updated value, described by POJO, if it has a attribute named a has a non-value 1 and a attribute named b has a null value, it will generate the SQL segment set a = 1 for the final SQL and the attribute will be ignored for SQL.
        condition - As same as condition parameter of buildDeleteSql(Class, Object)
        tableName - The table's name
        返回:
        Update SQL

      • buildUpdateSql

        public SQLObject buildUpdateSql(java.lang.Object newValue,
                       java.lang.Object condition,
                       java.lang.String[] notIgnoreNullFields)
        Generate update SQL of the specified table according by condition described by POJO.
        参数:
        newValue - The updated value, described by POJO, if it has a attribute named a has a non-value 1 and a attribute named b has a null value, it will generate the SQL segment set a = 1 for the final SQL, if b is included in notIgnoreNullFields parameter, the framework will generate "a = null" SQL segment for final SQL, otherwise the b attribute will be ignored
        condition - As same as condition parameter of buildDeleteSql(Class, Object)
        notIgnoreNullFields - Including fields that don't ignore null value, see the newValue parameter for detail
        返回:
        Update SQL

      • buildUpdateSql

        public SQLObject buildUpdateSql(java.lang.Object newValue,
                       java.lang.Object condition,
                       java.lang.String[] notIgnoreNullFields,
                       java.lang.String tableName)
        Generate update SQL of the specified table according by condition described by POJO.
        参数:
        newValue - The updated value, described by POJO, if it has a attribute named a has a non-value 1 and a attribute named b has a null value, it will generate the SQL segment set a = 1 for the final SQL, if b is included in notIgnoreNullFields parameter, the framework will generate "a = null" SQL segment for final SQL, otherwise the b attribute will be ignored
        condition - As same as condition parameter of buildDeleteSql(Class, Object)
        notIgnoreNullFields - Including fields that don't ignore null value, see the newValue parameter for detail
        tableName - The table's name
        返回:
        Update SQL

      • buildUpdateSqls

        public SQLObject[] buildUpdateSqls(java.lang.Object newValue,
                          java.lang.Object[] conditions)
        Generate update SQLs of the specified table according by conditions described by POJOs.
        参数:
        newValue - As same as buildUpdateSql(Object, Object)
        conditions - As same as buildUpdateSql(Object, Object), including several condition
        返回:
        Update SQLs

      • execSQL

        public void execSQL(SQLObject[] execSqls)
        Batch SQLs execution, may deal with some insertion, update, deletion in a single transaction, you should call the buildXXXSQL method for SQLObject parameter before call this method
        参数:
        execSqls - SQLs

      • execSQL

        public void execSQL(SQLObject[] execSqls,
           SQLiteDatabase db)
        Batch SQLs execution of a specified DB instance, may deal with some insertion, update, deletion in a single transaction, you should call the buildXXXSQL method for SQLObject parameter before call this method
        参数:
        execSqls - SQLs
        db - DB instance

      • execSQL

        Single SQL execution.
        参数:
        sql - SQL
        另请参阅:
        execSQL(SQLObject[])

      • insert

        public long insert(java.lang.Object object)
        Insert a POJO into the DB
        参数:
        object - POJO
        返回:
        The row id after inserted into the DB table

      • query

        public <T> T[] query(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
            T condition,
            java.lang.String[] fields,
            QueryAidParameter parameterObject)
        Query data according by the condition
        类型参数:
        T -
        参数:
        clazz - POJO class
        condition - As same as buildDeleteSql(Class, Object)
        fields - Queried columns, will query all columns if this parameter is null
        parameterObject - Aid Query parameter, such as group by, order by, having, limit and so one
        返回:
        The query result
        另请参阅:
        query(Class, Object)

      • queryCascadeByCondition

        public <T> T[] queryCascadeByCondition(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                              T condition,
                              java.lang.String[] childrenPaths)
        Query data according by condition, will query relation table
        The childrenPaths parameter is used to specify the queried relation tables. It put some relation paths, the path's rule is as follow: Starting from the root class, according to the related attribute of the root class is the root class association class associated attributes, in turn recursively, put these associated attributes according to the order. A mosaic, for example: there are three classes of T1, T2, T3, T1 through the attribute childList1 associated with T2, T2 by childList2 associated T3 (Association through com.huawei.softclient.common.database.OneToAny) annotation specified, if while searching for T1 records need also associated T2 and T3 records, related path should be childList1.childList2
        It's the sample code as follow: 
         tables = facade.queryByConditionCascade(T1.class, new String[] {
                "childList.childList2", "brother1.brother2.brother3" }, condition);
        Node: the method only support some simple scenario, you should turn to rawQuery(String, String[]) in the complex scenario
        类型参数:
        T -
        参数:
        clazz - POJO class
        condition - As same as buildDeleteSql(Class, Object)
        childrenPaths - Relation paths, It will only query the data of main table if this parameter is null.
        返回:
        Query result

      • queryCascadeByCondition

        public <T> T[] queryCascadeByCondition(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                              T condition,
                              java.lang.String[] childrenPaths,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,java.lang.String> tableMap)
        另请参阅:
        queryCascadeByCondition(Class, Object, String[])
